cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest today, then slowing and turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana to the MS/AL coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River FL (Florida Panhandle – not South Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA to the MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Indian Pass FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Isolated squalls with gusts under tropical-storm force possible; sustained TS winds unlikely (<5% probability).
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain and brief urban ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along South Florida beaches.
